prompt:
Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
For API PrintWriter.write, the API usage rule is: Write data to a PrintWriter, and if an Exception occurs, manage it by catching the Exception.
Write data to a PrintWriter, then close it, and if an Exception occurs during this process, handle it by catching the Exception.
Write data to a PrintWriter, then close it.

Question: I am trying to print a 2D array to a file: :I want to print 2D array to txt file on my desktop. It is important, that the output is formatted in way, that is in code, because it represents rows and seats.Code:package vaja15;import java.util.*;import java.io.PrintWriter;import java.io.File;import java.io.FileNotFoundException;public class Vaja15 {    public static void main(String[] args) throws FileNotFoundException     {        System.out.println("Vnesi velikost dvorane (vrste/sedezi):  ");        Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);        Random r  = new Random();        int vrst = sc.nextInt();        int sedezev = sc.nextInt();         int [][] dvorana  = new int [vrst][sedezev];        File  file = new File ("C:/users/mr/desktop/dvorana.txt");        for(int i = 0; i<dvorana.length; i++)        {            System.out.println();            for (int j = 0; j<dvorana.length; j++)            {                dvorana [i][j] = r.nextInt(3);                  System.out.print(dvorana[i][j]);                PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(file);                out.println(dvorana[i][j]);                out.close();            }           }     } }
Please using this api: PrintWriter.write.
Answer:
response:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>:
```java
package vaja15;
import java.util.*;
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;

public class Vaja15 {
    public static void main(String[] args) throws FileNotFoundException {
        System.out.println("Vnesi velikost dvorane (vrste/sedezi):  ");
        Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
        Random r = new Random();
        int vrst = sc.nextInt();
        int sedezev = sc.nextInt();
        int[][] dvorana = new int[vrst][sedezev];
        File file = new File("C:/users/mr/desktop/dvorana.txt");
        PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(file);
        
        for (int i = 0; i < dvorana.length; i++) {
            System.out.println();
            for (int j = 0; j < dvorana[i].length; j++) {
                dvorana[i][j] = r.nextInt(3);
                System.out.print(dvorana[i][j]);
                out.write(String.valueOf(dvorana[i][j]));
            }
            out.write(System.lineSeparator());
        }
        
        out.close();
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we are using the PrintWriter.write method to write the elements of the 2D array to a text file. We first create a PrintWriter object and pass the file object as a parameter to its constructor. Then, inside the nested for loop, we use the write method to write each element of the array to the file. We convert the integer value to a string using String.valueOf() before writing it. After writing each row, we use the write method again to write a line separator to move to the next line in the file. Finally, we close the PrintWriter object to ensure that all the data is written to the file.

message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>:
```java
package vaja15;
import java.util.*;
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;

public class Vaja15 {
    public static void main(String[] args) throws FileNotFoundException {
        System.out.println("Vnesi velikost dvorane (vrste/sedezi):  ");
        Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
        Random r = new Random();
        int vrst = sc.nextInt();
        int sedezev = sc.nextInt();
        int[][] dvorana = new int[vrst][sedezev];
        File file = new File("C:/users/mr/desktop/dvorana.txt");
        PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(file);
        
        for (int i = 0; i < dvorana.length; i++) {
            System.out.println();
            for (int j = 0; j < dvorana[i].length; j++) {
                dvorana[i][j] = r.nextInt(3);
                System.out.print(dvorana[i][j]);
                out.write(String.valueOf(dvorana[i][j]));
            }
            out.write(System.lineSeparator());
        }
        
        out.close();
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we are using the PrintWriter.write method to write the elements of the 2D array to a text file. We first create a PrintWriter object and pass the file object as a parameter to its constructor. Then, inside the nested for loop, we use the write method to write each element of the array to the file. We convert the integer value to a string using String.valueOf() before writing it. After writing each row, we use the write method again to write a line separator to move to the next line in the file. Finally, we close the PrintWriter object to ensure that all the data is written to the file.
